sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A briefe remonstrance of the reasons and grounds of those people commonly called Anabaptists, for their seperation, &c. Or certaine queries concerning their faith and practice, propounded by Mr. Robert Poole; answered and resolved by William Kiffin. Kiffin, William, 1616-1701.
[4], 15, [1] p.
s.n.], [London : Printed and published for publike information in the yeere 1645.
In the preface to his "A looking glasse for the Anabaptists and the rest of the separatists" (Wing R1430) Josiah Ricraft claims that he actually propounded these queries, "in behalfe of a friend of neere relation", i.e. Mr. Robert Poole. Annotation on Thomason copy: "July (London) 26". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[4], 15, [1] p.
s.n.], [London : Printed and published for publike information in the yeere 1645.
In the preface to his "A looking glasse for the Anabaptists and the rest of the separatists" (Wing R1430) Josiah Ricraft claims that he actually propounded these queries, "in behalfe of a friend of neere relation", i.e. Mr. Robert Poole. Annotation on Thomason copy: "July (London) 26". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
